sentences.english: As well as a blacksmith upgrade for purchasing additional war machines.
sentences.chinese: 而且鐵匠鋪可以升級以購買額外的戰爭機器。

sentences.english: His symbol was fire and a blacksmith's hammer.
sentences.chinese: 他的象徵是火和鐵匠的錘子。

sentences.english: Jia small gun and others design captures the mole, turned out to be a blacksmith.
sentences.chinese: 賈小槍等人設計抓住了內奸，原來是齊鐵匠。

sentences.english: Keep the horse's head up and still to make your farrier's work easier.
sentences.chinese: 讓馬擡着頭並且靜止能使蹄鐵匠的工作更加容易。

sentences.english: A father, who is working hardly as an ironsmith, brings up his son under the hardship of living.
sentences.chinese: 做鐵匠的父親，含辛茹苦地養着一個兒子。

sentences.english: In my youth my father bound me to a blacksmith.
sentences.chinese: 在我年輕時我父親立契讓我給一名鐵匠當學徒。

sentences.english: He was bound out to a blacksmith for three years.
sentences.chinese: 根據契約，他拜一位鐵匠爲師當三年學徒。

sentences.english: Instead, he asked the best blacksmiths of the Duchy to fashion him a new sword.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他命其領內最優秀的鐵匠鑄造一把新劍。

sentences.english: The smith forged the plow with great skill.
sentences.chinese: 那鐵匠技術嫺熟地鍛造馬的蹄鐵。

sentences.english: The wind blowing their hair untidily.
sentences.chinese: 吹亂了青年旋工和鐵匠的頭髮。

sentences.english: Keeping these shoes in good repair is the job of six blacksmiths .
sentences.chinese: 修理這些馬掌是六個鐵匠的活。

sentences.english: Typically, most blacksmiths buy or are given rare jewels from other players.
sentences.chinese: 通常多數鐵匠會從其他玩家手中獲得珍稀的寶石。

sentences.english: The blacksmith came out of the forge to fit the horseshoe.
sentences.chinese: 鐵匠從鐵工廠出來安裝馬蹄鐵。

sentences.english: The blacksmith's wife heard what he said, and went off, sulking.
sentences.chinese: 鐵匠妻子聽到了他所說的話，生着悶氣走了。

sentences.english: A man who shoes horses is called a farrier.
sentences.chinese: 爲馬釘蹄鐵的人叫做蹄鐵匠。

definition: to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter (Tw)
